abstract: A fresh analysis of a path toward feeding some 9 billion people with the fewest environmental regrets.
snippet: A fresh analysis of a path toward feeding some 9 billion people with the fewest environmental regrets.
lead_paragraph: Justin Gillis has posted a very helpful new piece on the Green blog that builds on efforts I've made here to get beyond the eternal food fight. Below you can read the key passage in which Gillis discusses "Solutions for a Cultivated Planet," a new Nature paper from Jonathan Foley of the University of Minnesota and many co-authors. The core themes in the paper are echoed in a TEDx talk Foley gave last year:

headline.main: A Path Toward Sustaining a 'Cultivated Planet'
